title: Japanese Beef Stir-Fry Recipe
description: Tender beef strips are quickly stir-fried with crisp and colorful vegetables to make this delicious restaurant-style dinner in your own kitchen.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Dinner Japanese Beef Stir-Fry 4.6 (274) 195 Reviews 123 Photos Tender beef strips are quickly stir-fried with crisp and colorful vegetables to make this delicious restaurant-style dinner in your own kitchen. Submitted by Campbell's Kitchen Updated on November 20, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 123 123 123 123 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 pounds boneless beef sirloin or beef top round steaks (3/4" thick) 3 tablespoons cornstarch 1 (10.5 ounce) can Campbell's® Condensed Beef Broth ½ cup soy sauce 2 tablespoons sugar 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 4 cups sliced shiitake mushrooms 1 head Chinese cabbage (bok choy), thinly sliced 2 medium red peppers, cut into 2"-long strips 3 stalks celery, sliced 2 medium green onions, cut into 2" pieces Hot cooked regular long-grain white rice Directions Slice beef into very thin strips. Mix cornstarch, broth, soy and sugar until smooth. Set aside. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in saucepot or wok over high heat. Add beef in 2 batches and stir-fry until browned. Set beef aside. Add 1 tablespoon oil. Add the mushrooms, cabbage, peppers, celery and green onions in 2 batches and stir-fry over medium heat until tender-crisp. Set vegetables aside. Stir cornstarch mixture and add. Cook until mixture boils and thickens, stirring constantly. Return beef and vegetables to saucepot and heat through. Serve over rice. Recipe Tips To make slicing meat easier, freeze beef for 1 hour.To make ahead, prepare vegetables, place them in resealable plastic bags, and refrigerate overnight. I Made It Print 584 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Japanese Beef Stir-Fry 01 of 123 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 123 Photo by  Meg Strathern 04/19/2024 Great flavors I added my own veggie mix, doubled the sauce and did ramen noodles. I will definitely make this again! 03 of 123 Photo by  Diana Trevio 12/30/2023 I’ve made this recipe several times. Only thing I leave out are the mushrooms as I’m not a fan but comes out delicious every time. I have a few picky eaters but they always love it! 04 of 123 Photo by  dave 08/23/2023 I also added garlic as well as ginger, water chestnuts, broccoli and baby corn 05 of 123 Photo by  migrant 07/03/2021 06 of 123 Photo by  dee2205 05/15/2021 07 of 123 Photo by  TJ Gorski 05/07/2021 Turned out sooooo good. Great recipe (skipped the rice). 08 of 123 Photo by  Nanette Malcolm 04/30/2021 Delicious! I'm wondering if this can be adapted to chicken as well. 09 of 123 Photo by  rick 03/29/2021 10 of 123 Photo by  Timothy Carlson 03/08/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Orange Peel Beef 56 Ratings Chinese Pepper Round Steak 59 Ratings Nikujaga (Japanese-style meat and potatoes) 20 Ratings Super-Simple, Super-Spicy Mongolian Beef 465 Ratings Chap Chee Noodles 132 Ratings Beef with Vegetables 91 Ratings Black Pepper Beef and Cabbage Stir Fry 780 Ratings Mongolian Beef 51 Ratings Healthy Steak Stir-Fry 12 Ratings Bitter Melon and Black Bean Sauce Beef 7 Ratings Japchae 25 Ratings Gyudon Japanese Beef Bowl 11 Ratings Beef with Green Onion 37 Ratings Spicy Sweet Steak Stir Fry 4 Ratings Mild Thai Beef with a Tangerine Sauce 6 Ratings Sukiyaki 27 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Campbell's Kitchen
instructions: Slice beef into very thin strips.;Mix cornstarch, broth, soy and sugar until smooth. Set aside.;Heat 1 tablespoon oil in saucepot or wok over high heat. Add beef in 2 batches and stir-fry until browned. Set beef aside.;Add 1 tablespoon oil. Add the mushrooms, cabbage, peppers, celery and green onions in 2 batches and stir-fry over medium heat until tender-crisp. Set vegetables aside.;Stir cornstarch mixture and add. Cook until mixture boils and thickens, stirring constantly. Return beef and vegetables to saucepot and heat through. Serve over rice.
